general.title: 1. General Cancellation Rules
general.content: VoilaFerry acts as an intermediary between you and ferry operators. Cancellation policies vary depending on the ferry operator, route, and fare type selected at the time of booking.
general.note: The specific cancellation terms applicable to your booking are displayed during the booking process and included in your booking confirmation email.

timeframes.title: 2. Standard Cancellation Timeframes
timeframes.note: * These are general guidelines. Actual refund amounts depend on the operator's specific policy and fare type. Flexible fares may offer better cancellation terms.

howToCancel.title: 3. How to Cancel a Booking
steps: Log in to your VoilaFerry account
Select the booking you wish to cancel
Click "Cancel Booking" and follow the instructions
You will receive a confirmation email with refund details
howToCancel.alternative: Alternatively, you can contact our customer support team at

refundProcessing.title: 4. Refund Processing
items: Refunds are processed within 5-10 business days
Refunds are issued to the original payment method
Bank processing times may add 3-5 additional business days
You will receive an email confirmation when the refund is processed

nonRefundable.title: 5. Non-Refundable Bookings
nonRefundable.intro: Some fare types are marked as "Non-Refundable" at the time of booking. These bookings:
items: Cannot be cancelled for a refund
May be eligible for date/time changes (subject to availability and fees)
May be eligible for credit vouchers in exceptional circumstances

operatorCancellations.title: 6. Operator Cancellations
operatorCancellations.intro: If a ferry operator cancels a sailing due to weather, technical issues, or other reasons:
items: You are entitled to a full refund
You may choose to rebook on an alternative sailing at no extra cost
We will notify you as soon as we receive cancellation information from the operator

modifications.title: 7. Booking Modifications
modifications.intro: Instead of cancelling, you may be able to modify your booking:
items: Date and time changes are subject to availability
Modification fees may apply depending on fare type
Price differences must be paid if the new sailing costs more
No refund is given if the new sailing costs less

protection.title: 8. Cancellation Protection
protection.intro: We offer optional Cancellation Protection that provides additional flexibility:
items: Cancel for any reason up to 24 hours before departure
Receive up to 80% refund regardless of fare type
Protection must be purchased at the time of booking
Cost is typically 5-10% of the booking value

contact.title: 9. Contact Us
contact.intro: For questions about our cancellation policy or assistance with your booking:
contact.liveChat: Live Chat: Available on our website

introduction.title: 1. Introduction
introduction.welcome: Welcome to VoilaFerry. These Terms and Conditions ("Terms") govern your use of our website, mobile application, and services (collectively, the "Service"). By accessing or using our Service, you agree to be bound by these Terms.

serviceDescription.title: 2. Service Description
serviceDescription.intro: VoilaFerry provides an online platform for comparing and booking ferry tickets across multiple operators serving Mediterranean routes. We act as an intermediary between you and the ferry operators.
items: We do not operate any ferries ourselves
The contract of carriage is between you and the ferry operator
We facilitate the booking process and provide customer support

account.title: 3. Account Registration
account.intro: To use certain features of our Service, you may need to create an account. You agree to:
items: Provide accurate, current, and complete information
Maintain and update your information to keep it accurate
Maintain the security of your account credentials
Accept responsibility for all activities under your account
Notify us immediately of any unauthorized use

makingBooking.title: 4.1 Making a Booking
makingBooking.intro: When you make a booking through our Service:
items: You confirm that all passenger information provided is accurate
You accept the fare rules and conditions displayed at booking
You authorize payment for the total amount shown
A binding contract is formed when you receive booking confirmation

pricing.title: 4.2 Pricing
pricing.content: All prices are displayed in Euros (EUR) and include applicable taxes unless otherwise stated. Prices may change until a booking is confirmed. We reserve the right to correct any pricing errors, even after a booking is made.

payment.title: 5. Payment
items: Payment is due at the time of booking
We accept major credit/debit cards (Visa, Mastercard, American Express)
All payments are processed securely through our payment provider (Stripe)
Your card will be charged in EUR
Currency conversion fees may apply if your card is in a different currency

passengerResponsibilities.title: 7. Passenger Responsibilities
passengerResponsibilities.intro: As a passenger, you are responsible for:
items: Arriving at the port with sufficient time before departure (minimum 90 minutes recommended)
Carrying valid travel documents (passport, ID, visa if required)
Complying with vehicle requirements if traveling with a vehicle
Declaring any dangerous goods or special requirements
Following the ferry operator's rules and crew instructions
Ensuring children are supervised at all times

travelDocuments.title: 8. Travel Documents
travelDocuments.intro: You are solely responsible for ensuring you have all necessary travel documents:
items: Valid passport or national ID card
Visas where required
Vehicle registration documents (if applicable)
Pet passports and health certificates (if traveling with pets)
travelDocuments.note: We are not responsible for any denial of boarding due to inadequate documentation.

liability.title: 9. Limitation of Liability
liability.intro: To the maximum extent permitted by law:
items: We are not liable for the acts or omissions of ferry operators
We are not liable for delays, cancellations, or changes to ferry services
Our liability is limited to the amount you paid for your booking
We are not liable for indirect, consequential, or special damages

intellectualProperty.title: 10. Intellectual Property
intellectualProperty.content: All content on our Service, including text, graphics, logos, and software, is our property or licensed to us and is protected by intellectual property laws. You may not reproduce, distribute, or create derivative works without our express written consent.

governingLaw.title: 13. Governing Law
governingLaw.content: These Terms are governed by the laws of France. Any disputes shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Paris, France, unless EU consumer protection regulations provide otherwise.

contact.title: 14. Contact Information
contact.intro: For questions about these Terms, please contact us:

introduction.title: 1. Introduction
introduction.content: VoilaFerry ("we", "us", "our") is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our website and services.
introduction.gdpr: We comply with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and other applicable data protection laws in the European Union.

dataController.title: 2. Data Controller
dataController.intro: The data controller responsible for your personal data is:

provided.title: 3.1 Information You Provide
items: Account information (name, email, password)
Booking details (passenger names, contact information)
Payment information (processed securely by Stripe)
Communication preferences
Customer support inquiries

automatic.title: 3.2 Information Collected Automatically
items: Device information (browser type, operating system)
IP address and approximate location
Usage data (pages visited, features used)
Cookies and similar technologies

thirdParty.title: 3.3 Information from Third Parties
items: Social login data (if you sign in with Google)
Ferry operators (booking updates, schedule changes)

howWeUse.title: 4. How We Use Your Information
items: Process and manage your bookings
Send booking confirmations and travel updates
Provide customer support
Process payments and refunds
Send marketing communications (with your consent)
Improve our services and user experience
Detect and prevent fraud
Comply with legal obligations

legalBasis.title: 5. Legal Basis for Processing (GDPR)
legalBasis.intro: We process your data based on:
items: Contract: Processing necessary to fulfill your booking
Consent: For marketing communications and non-essential cookies
Legitimate interests: Service improvement, fraud prevention, analytics
Legal obligation: Compliance with applicable laws

dataSharing.title: 6. Data Sharing
items: Ferry operators: To process and manage your bookings
Payment processors: Stripe, for secure payment processing
Service providers: Hosting, email, customer support tools
Analytics providers: To improve our services
Legal authorities: When required by law
dataSharing.noSale: We do not sell your personal data to third parties.

dataRetention.title: 8. Data Retention
items: Account data: Until you delete your account
Booking data: 7 years for legal/tax compliance
Marketing data: Until you unsubscribe
Analytics data: 26 months

yourRights.title: 9. Your Rights (GDPR)
yourRights.intro: Under GDPR, you have the right to:
items: Access: Request a copy of your personal data
Rectification: Correct inaccurate or incomplete data
Erasure: Request deletion of your data ("right to be forgotten")
Restriction: Limit how we process your data
Portability: Receive your data in a portable format
Object: Object to processing based on legitimate interests
Withdraw consent: Withdraw consent at any time
yourRights.exercise: To exercise your rights, contact us at

security.title: 10. Data Security
security.intro: We implement appropriate security measures to protect your data:
items: SSL/TLS encryption for all data transmission
Secure payment processing through Stripe (PCI DSS compliant)
Access controls and authentication
Regular security audits and updates
Employee training on data protection

contact.title: 13. Contact Us
contact.intro: For questions about this Privacy Policy or to exercise your data rights:
contact.complaint: You also have the right to lodge a complaint with your local data protection authority (in France: CNIL - Commission Nationale de l'Informatique et des Libert√©s).

whatAreCookies.title: 1. What Are Cookies?
whatAreCookies.content: Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device when you visit a website. They help websites remember your preferences, understand how you use the site, and provide a better user experience.

howWeUse.title: 2. How We Use Cookies
howWeUse.intro: VoilaFerry uses cookies for the following purposes:

essential.title: 2.1 Essential Cookies
essential.description: These cookies are necessary for the website to function properly. They enable core functionality such as security, network management, and account access.

functional.title: 2.2 Functional Cookies
functional.description: These cookies enable enhanced functionality and personalization, such as remembering your language preference and recent searches.

analytics.title: 2.3 Analytics Cookies
analytics.description: These cookies help us understand how visitors interact with our website by collecting and reporting information anonymously.

marketing.title: 2.4 Marketing Cookies
marketing.description: These cookies are used to track visitors across websites to display relevant advertisements. We only use these with your consent.

thirdParty.title: 3. Third-Party Cookies
thirdParty.intro: Some cookies are placed by third-party services that appear on our pages:
items: Stripe: For secure payment processing
Google: Analytics and sign-in functionality
Sentry: Error tracking and performance monitoring

managing.title: 4. Managing Cookies
managing.intro: You can control and manage cookies in several ways:

consentBanner.title: 4.1 Cookie Consent Banner
consentBanner.description: When you first visit our website, you can choose which cookie categories to accept through our cookie consent banner. You can change these preferences at any time by clicking the "Cookie Settings" link in our footer.

browserSettings.title: 4.2 Browser Settings
browserSettings.description: Most browsers allow you to manage cookies through their settings. Here's how to access cookie settings in popular browsers:

optOut.title: 4.3 Opt-Out Links
optOut.description: You can opt out of certain third-party cookies:

impact.title: 5. Impact of Disabling Cookies
impact.intro: If you disable certain cookies, some parts of our website may not function properly:
items: You may need to log in more frequently
Your preferences may not be saved
Some features may be unavailable
The booking process may be affected
impact.note: Essential cookies cannot be disabled as they are necessary for the website to function.

contact.title: 7. Contact Us
contact.intro: If you have questions about our use of cookies, please contact us:
